body:
Well, it's a dev-env-only feature... But anyways, Ruby 2.2 introduced GC for symbols (cc @carpodaster), so as long as you don't do a
```ruby
define_method(string.to_sym)
```
DoS from converting any strings to symbols should not be a problem.

However, if you prefer strings, feel free to switch to them. I just proposed symbols because I personally prefer them over strings. But the whole logic works with strings as good as with symbols (just need to switch `%i()` to `%w()` then).
body_html:
Well, it's a dev-env-only feature... But anyways, Ruby 2.2 introduced GC for symbols (cc @carpodaster), so as long as you don't do a

define_method(string.to_sym)

DoS from converting any strings to symbols should not be a problem.

However, if you prefer strings, feel free to switch to them. I just proposed symbols because I personally prefer them over strings. But the whole logic works with strings as good as with symbols (just need to switch %i() to %w() then).
body_text:
Well, it's a dev-env-only feature... But anyways, Ruby 2.2 introduced GC for symbols (cc @carpodaster), so as long as you don't do a
define_method(string.to_sym)
DoS from converting any strings to symbols should not be a problem.
However, if you prefer strings, feel free to switch to them. I just proposed symbols because I personally prefer them over strings. But the whole logic works with strings as good as with symbols (just need to switch %i() to %w() then).
